metadata.title: CVE-2023-0459 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Copy_from_user on 64-bit versions of the Linux kernel does not implementthe __uaccess_begin_nospec allowing a user to bypass the "access_ok" checkand pass a kernel pointer to copy_from_user(). This would allow an attackerto leak information. We recommend upgrading beyond commit74e19ef0ff8061ef55957c3abd71614ef0f42f47

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0459` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required
